intro: Calamintha officinalis f. boveana, commonly known as Bovean mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in whorls and range in color from pink to purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. The leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine for their soothing and aromatic properties.
